name: The Lanesborough, a St. Regis Hotel

reviews.text: After a recommendation from a colleague I decided to treat my mother to Afternoon Tea at the Lanesborough as a birthday treat. The whole experience was amazing! Having booked in advance we were led to a very pleasant table where we could view the pianist and the rest of the dining area with ease. The Tea Sommelier was extremely courteous and helpful, as were all the staff. I can quite honestly say that the service was exceptional without ever feeling intrusive and the food was exquisite! From a delicious little sweet appetiser to the extremely tasty array of sandwiches (of which we had a second round ), followed by a toasted tea cake and scones with clotted cream and preserve, to the dainty little cakes. It was with regret that we couldn't quite clear everything. To top it all my mother was brought a little portion of fruit topped with a candle on a beautifully decorated plate on which Happy Birthday had been written in chocolate. The pianist asked her for a request and she was delighted that he was able to play part of the Blue Danube for her.
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea was delightful

reviews.text: We left feeling that we had been made to feel special and truly spoiled and as such it will become a treasured memory.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea - without the tea

reviews.text: The whole point of paying out this much for scones, cakes and tea which you could get at your local supermarket is.....SERVICE!! Sadly whilst there were plenty of waiting staff available during tea, there was no-one ready to check and refill our teas! I guess there isn't much of an incentive when service charge is mandatory.
reviews.title: Our perfect wedding

reviews.text: My tea issue would not have been such a problem if the hotel had not helpfully placed all our unmarked teapots on a separate side table to make space. I guess eventually I would have worked it out myself which was mine, and could have gotten up to locate my tea but like I say, you would have expected at this end of the market, more attentive staff.....after all detail matters and I don't want to have to stare mournfully at my empty teacup for ten minutes before the message gets across that I have no tea.
reviews.title: Romantic, intimate, perfect

reviews.text: Try Browns, Berkely and Fortnums.....much better service.
reviews.title: It smells like in a kitchen

reviews.text: we booked for afternoon tea for the family including 9 month old baby for a special occasion and it was fabulous Service was spot on choice of tea was excellent important for me as tea is my thing Food was excellent and decor a joy especially the flowers Can't wait to do it again a real 5 star experience
reviews.title: afternoon tea treat

reviews.text: I was booked in here for 4 nights by Amex Centurion service. I left at 0730 after 1 night. Why? I have stayed here before (8+years ago) and now the rooms/hotel are plain worn-out and outdated. Worse, they are seemingly very cramped. My Junior Suite (rack rate £1,100 approx) had only a single basin (and a small one at that) with no shelving; I've seen larger bathrooms in airport Holiday Inns. The lighting arrangements are uber complex. Touch screen pads instead of switches, bulbs blown (housekeeping where are you?!) just a irritating puzzle game to find an ambient light. Worst of all was the smoke. Floor 3 was (I was told a non-smoking floor) yet guests were allowed to smoke in certain rooms/suites. Cigar smoke pervaded the corridors and my room. I am NOT a anti-smoking fascist, I just don't want to wake up to stale cigar smoke that had wafted into my room. The St Regis 'Butler Service' is outdated and very poorly executed too, however 'well-meaning'. The whole hotel had an air of being run down, tatty at the edges. That said, the location is good-ish and breakfast was, well, just breakfast. I can't comment on their bar or dining 'experience' and my 30 min massage was capable, but expensive.
reviews.title: Very 'tired' hotel now.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were taken to tea there as a wedding present and it was absolutely fabulous. Ok it's not cheap but for a treat it's just superb. Beautiful setting, lovely food, very, dainty but you can order as much as you like, and of course delicious tea,,try out the library bar beforehand do a great Bloody Mary(I tried the yellow one..)
reviews.title: Fabulous Tea...for that special occasion..

reviews.text: Looking for that special treat? Well this could well be the place..
reviews.title: 40th Birthday

reviews.text: The Cellar dining room was the surprise venue for my stepson's recent 40th celebratory luncheon and everything about The Lanesborough and The Cellar was first class. Champagne at midday was followed by a delicious three course luncheon with complementary wines.
reviews.title: Sorry London hotels, I'll never stay anywhere else!!

reviews.text: My husband and I regularly visit London and very much look forward to and enjoy the gracious hospitality of the city. As we love the St. Regis Hotel in New York, we thought it would be fun to visit the Lanesborough for a cocktail and cigar. Big mistake. The service was off-putting and unfriendly, a style which we thought had been gone from luxury travel for quite some time. Not at all elegant, but arrogant. After a brief stay, we were so uncomfortable we left. Final thought, never again.
reviews.title: Arrogance of yester year

reviews.text: Had a wonderful afternoon tea to celebrate my wife's birthday. Totally recomended
reviews.title: Fantastic afternoon tea

reviews.text: My wife and I plus our daughter and friend took afternoon tea, with champagne, at Ashley's here at The Lanesborogh. The staff were very friendly and so helpful too.
reviews.title: Simply the Best Aftenoon Tea in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our third visit as we love having our tea here as a special treat in December each year! The food, including delicious sandwiches and cakes is creative and blends perfectly with the glass of champagne. The fresh strawberrys were amazing and the scones with clotted cream just "yummy"!!!
reviews.title: One of the best 5 star hotels on the planet

reviews.text: Something new this year, well I don't remember being served it last year, is mulled wine which just about finished us all off!!! All in all, a fantastic experience once again and one that I would recommend you try for yourselves. A big thank you to the staff who served us and a special thank you to the hotel manager, a Mr Michael Naylor-Leyland who greeted us so nicely and always seems to be around when we visit and is professional and attentive. He has a great team!
reviews.title: World Wide, my favorite place to stay.

reviews.text: The Lanesborough is an incredible building (just shows how good the NHS used to be) that's now an incredible hotel.
reviews.title: Location & Style

reviews.text: The sheer opulence is a wonder in itself especially at Christmas time. With trees & lights everywhere it's a very well turned out Hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing everything...but £34 for a croissant and coffee?!

reviews.text: The staff (with one minor exception) were kind, friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel for Afternoon Tea!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was all cooked to a high standard and most enjoyable.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel ever!

reviews.text: This Hotel is in an unrivalled position in location and style and met all expectations.
reviews.title: Biggest event of my life so far - best hotel on the planet.

description: The Lanesborough is ideally located in prestigious Knightsbridge overlooking Hyde Park featuring 95 guest rooms including 43 suites. Guests of The Lanesborough are received as honoured guests in a private home and cared for by personal butlers.
